subject: Photography
title: Symmetry and Reflection
description: Learn Symmetry and Reflection in one minute.

hook.text: The Taj Mahal reflected in water. A face split perfectly down the middle. Symmetry feels deeply satisfying.

buildup.text: Symmetrical compositions divide the frame into mirror halves. They convey order, calm, and formal beauty.

discovery.text: Reflections in water, glass, or polished surfaces create natural symmetry. They double the visual impact.

twist.text: Perfect symmetry can feel sterile. A slight imperfection â€” a ripple, a shadow â€” often makes it more interesting.

climax.text: Wes Anderson built an entire film style on symmetry. It works in movies and in photographs alike.

punchline.text: Symmetry is beauty. Imperfect symmetry is art.

quiz.question: What mood does symmetry typically create in a photo?
